definition: compact edition (of a dictionary etc)
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
Hanyu Da Cidian, the largest Chinese dictionary, with over 375,000 word entries, first published 1986-1994
Hanyu Da Zidian, one of the most comprehensive Chinese character dictionaries with 54,678 (and later 60,370) entries, first published between 1986-1990
revised edition (of a book)
Cihai, an encyclopedic dictionary first published in 1915, and frequently revised
pocket book/paperback
Zhonghua Zihai, the most comprehensive Chinese character dictionary with 85,568 entries, compiled in 1994
paperback (book)
the Twenty-Four Histories (25 or 26 in modern editions), collection of books on Chinese dynastic history from 3000 BC till 17th century/fig. a long and complicated story
the Kangxi Dictionary, named after the Kangxi Emperor, who in 1710 ordered its compilation, containing 47,035 single-character entries
revised and enlarged edition
twenty four dynastic histories (or 25 or 26 in modern editions)
Jinpingmei or the Golden Lotus (1617), Ming dynasty vernacular novel, formerly notorious and banned for its sexual content
character book (i.e. school primer)
paperback/paper-cover
dictionary/encyclopedia
reference book (such as dictionary, almanac, gazetteer etc)
